bill_title: Commending and recognizing Nicole Siebrasse on her selection as a recipient of a 2004 Prudential Spirit of Community Award.

bill_versions.bill_text: A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Commending and recognizing Nicole Siebrasse on her selection as a recipient of a 2004 Prudential Spirit of Community Award. WHEREAS, Nicole Siebrasse, an esteemed resident of Aberdeen, South Dakota, and a student at Aberdeen Central High School, has achieved national recognition for exemplary volunteer service by receiving a 2004 Prudential Spirit of Community Award; and WHEREAS, this prestigious award, presented by Prudential Financial in partnership with the National Association of Secondary School Principals, honors young volunteers across America who have demonstrated an extraordinary commitment to serving their communities; and WHEREAS, Ms. Siebrasse earned this award by giving generously of her time and energy creating a musical listening and learning program entitled "Entertainment, Education, and the Elderly" for residents of a local assisted living center; and WHEREAS, the success of the State of South Dakota, the strength of our communities, and the overall vitality of American society depend, in great measure, upon the dedication of young people like Ms. Siebrasse who use their considerable talents and resources to serve others: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-ninth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that Nicole Siebrasse of Aberdeen, South Dakota, be commended on her selection as a recipient of a Prudential Spirit of Community Award, recognized for her outstanding record of volunteer service, peer leadership, and community spirit, and extended best wishes for her continued success and happiness.

A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Commending and recognizing Nicole Siebrasse on her selection as a recipient of a 2004 Prudential Spirit of Community Award. WHEREAS, Nicole Siebrasse, an esteemed resident of Aberdeen, South Dakota, and a student at Aberdeen Central High School, has achieved national recognition for exemplary volunteer service by receiving a 2004 Prudential Spirit of Community Award; and WHEREAS, this prestigious award, presented by Prudential Financial in partnership with the National Association of Secondary School Principals, honors young volunteers across America who have demonstrated an extraordinary commitment to serving their communities; and WHEREAS, Ms. Siebrasse earned this award by giving generously of her time and energy creating a musical listening and learning program entitled "Entertainment, Education, and the Elderly" for residents of a local assisted living center; and WHEREAS, the success of the State of South Dakota, the strength of our communities, and the overall vitality of American society depend, in great measure, upon the dedication of young people like Ms. Siebrasse who use their considerable talents and resources to serve others: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-ninth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that Nicole Siebrasse of Aberdeen, South Dakota, be commended on her selection as a recipient of a Prudential Spirit of Community Award, recognized for her outstanding record of volunteer service, peer leadership, and community spirit, and extended best wishes for her continued success and happiness.
